intro: Sphaeralcea digitata var. tenuipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has pinnately divided leaves and is often found in dry, sandy soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
